name: Akki Roti
history: Akki Roti, a staple in Karnataka, is a rice-based flatbread. 'Akki' means rice in Kannada, and this dish is a popular breakfast item in the region.
description: Akki Roti is a flatbread made from rice flour, mixed with vegetables, green chilies, and spices. It's typically served with chutney and makes for a nutritious and filling meal.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine rice flour, chopped onions, grated carrot, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, and salt. Gradually add water and knead to form a soft dough.

instructions.title: Shape the Roti
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Flatten each ball either by patting it with your hands on a greased plastic sheet or by using a rolling pin.

instructions.title: Cook the Roti
instructions.description: Heat a tawa or flat pan. Place the flattened dough on it and cook until brown spots appear on both sides, applying oil as needed.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Akki Roti hot with coconut chutney or pickle.

tips: The dough should be soft and non-sticky for easy shaping.
Cooking on a medium flame ensures even cooking without burning.
variations: Add grated coconut or spinach for a different flavor.
Mix in some yogurt to the dough for softer rotis.

storage.shelfLife: Akki Roti is best enjoyed fresh but can be stored for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a tawa before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a tawa or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Garnish with a sprinkle of grated coconut or serve with a slice of lemon.
